unnormalised: **Telecom Boost: Reliance Jio Extends Fiber-to-Home Reach in Tier 2 Cities**
normalised: **Telecom Boost: Reliance Jio Extends Fiber-to-Home Reach in Tier two Cities**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26th – Reliance Jio announced a significant expansion of its JioFiber service footprint today, targeting enhanced connectivity in Tier 2 cities across India. The company aims to deploy over 5,000 km of fiber optic cable in the next quarter, focusing on regions like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty sixth – Reliance Jio announced a significant expansion of its JioFiber service footprint today, targeting enhanced connectivity in Tier two cities across India. The company aims to deploy over five thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable in the next quarter, focusing on regions like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

unnormalised: This infrastructure upgrade will provide high-speed internet access to homes and businesses, facilitating access to online education, e-commerce, and other digital services. JioFiber plans start at Rs. 699 per month, with options scaling up to 1 Gbps speeds.
normalised: This infrastructure upgrade will provide high-speed internet access to homes and businesses, facilitating access to online education, e-commerce, and other digital services. JioFiber plans start at rupee six hundred and ninety nine per month, with options scaling up to one G b p s speeds.

unnormalised: "Just like 'Lagaan' united a village, we envision JioFiber uniting communities through seamless connectivity," stated Isha Ambani, Director, Reliance Jio, at a press conference. The IIT Bombay-incubated startup, AirJaldi, has also partnered to provide rural Wi-Fi access leveraging Jio’s backbone. This initiative aims to bridge the digital divide, particularly impacting access to critical services like telehealth and online banking for rural households.
normalised: "Just like 'Lagaan' united a village, we envision JioFiber uniting communities through seamless connectivity," stated Isha Ambani, Director, Reliance Jio, at a press conference. The I I T Bombay-incubated startup, AirJaldi, has also partnered to provide rural Wi-Fi access leveraging Jio’s backbone. This initiative aims to bridge the digital divide, particularly impacting access to critical services like telehealth and online banking for rural households.
